description: Specify clump or pebble group names. Groups are used to organize clumps and apply commands to specific subsets. By default, the group name is assigned to the slot 'Default'. The optional pebble keyword can be given before the optional range to specify that the group name will be applied to pebbles. In this case, the range is applied to pebbles and not to clumps. IMPORTANT: The 'add' and 'remove' keywords apply to ALL clumps/pebbles (or a previously active range), they cannot be combined with a 'range' keyword in the same command.

keywords.name: slot
keywords.description: Assign group s to slot slot (default slot: 'Default'). Can be combined with range

keywords.name: add
keywords.description: Assign group s to next available slot for ALL clumps/pebbles (cannot be used with range in same command)

keywords.name: remove
keywords.description: Remove group s from all slots for ALL clumps/pebbles (cannot be used with range in same command)

keywords.name: pebble
keywords.description: Apply group to pebbles instead of clumps. When this keyword is used, the range is applied to pebbles and not to clumps

notes: Default behavior: group assigned to slot 'Default'
With pebble keyword: range applies to pebbles, not clumps
Without pebble keyword: range applies to clumps
Use of the group logic is described in Groups documentation

examples.description: Assign the group 'outer' to all clumps in the Default slot
Assign the group 'FrontLeft' to all clumps in the Default slot. The x- and y- components of the clump centroids must fall within the specified ranges for the group to be applied
Remove the group 'outer' from all slots for all clumps
Assign clumps 1-100 to group 'aggregate' in slot 'material'
Assign clumps in z-range 0-10 to group 'active' in default slot
Assign ALL clumps to group 'active' in next available slot
Assign group 'pebble_group' to pebbles with IDs 1-50 (range applies to pebbles)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Clump.set_group(group_name, slot=None) for clumps - requires iteration: for c in itasca.clump.list(): c.set_group('name'). For pebbles: use Ball.set_group() on pebble balls
